how-it-works.title: How does Jan de Belastingman work?

steps.title: 1. Ask your question 24/7 and get instant answers
steps.description: Do you have a question about your taxes? At Jan the Tax Man, you can ask your question online and get an immediate clear answer from our smart AI chatbot. It's directly connected to the most up-to-date tax data, so whether it's about deductions, allowances, or your tax return, you'll always get a quick and reliable solution – without waiting!

steps.title: 2. Need more help? We'll find you a suitable advisor
steps.description: Sometimes a question is too specific or personal for our chatbot, which can't yet apply all rules to your unique situation. No problem! Within 24 hours, Jan the Tax Man will connect you with an expert advisor who fully understands your situation and will personally work out the rules for you. This way, you'll always get the help that fits your needs, hassle-free.

steps.title: 3. Create an account and manage your tax questions
steps.description: With a free account at Jan the Tax Man, you can keep everything organized in one place. Easily sign up via social login (Google or Facebook) or email and save all your tax questions and answers in one location. This way, you can always review what you've asked - from allowances to deductions - and don't have to start over each time. Convenient for now and later, for example during your next tax return!

form.title: Waar heb je hulp bij nodig?

message.label: Je vraag of situatie
message.placeholder: Beschrijf je situatie zodat we je kunnen koppelen aan de juiste adviseur...

form.privacyConsent: Ik ga akkoord met de privacyvoorwaarden en geef toestemming om contact met mij op te nemen.

success.title: Bedankt voor je aanvraag!
success.message: We hebben je gegevens ontvangen en zullen binnen 24 uur contact met je opnemen om je te koppelen aan de juiste adviseur.

items.name: Martijn de Vries
items.quote: Dankzij Jan de Belastingman heb ik een uitstekende fiscalist gevonden die mijn BV-structuur heeft geoptimaliseerd. Dit heeft me duizenden euro's bespaard.

items.name: Sophie Jansen
items.quote: De adviseur waar ik aan gekoppeld werd begreep mijn situatie als freelancer perfect. Eindelijk iemand die mijn administratie op orde heeft gebracht!

items.name: Thomas Bakker
items.quote: Het matchingsproces was snel en efficiënt. Binnen een dag had ik contact met een adviseur die precies wist hoe hij mijn internationale belastingvraagstuk moest aanpakken.

items.question: Hoe werkt het matchingsproces?
items.answer: Na het invullen van het formulier bekijken wij je vraag en situatie. Op basis daarvan selecteren we een adviseur uit ons netwerk die het beste past bij jouw behoeften. Binnen 24 uur nemen we contact met je op om je te koppelen aan deze adviseur.

items.question: Zijn er kosten verbonden aan de matching?
items.answer: Nee, het matchingsproces is volledig gratis en vrijblijvend. Je betaalt alleen voor de diensten die je eventueel afneemt bij de adviseur waarmee we je in contact brengen.

items.question: Wat voor adviseurs zitten er in jullie netwerk?
items.answer: Ons netwerk bestaat uit gecertificeerde belastingadviseurs, accountants, administratiekantoren en fiscaal juristen. Alle adviseurs zijn zorgvuldig geselecteerd op basis van hun expertise, ervaring en klanttevredenheid.

items.question: Kan ik ook een adviseur vinden voor mijn particuliere belastingaangifte?
items.answer: Zeker! We hebben adviseurs die gespecialiseerd zijn in zowel zakelijke als particuliere belastingzaken. Of je nu hulp nodig hebt bij je inkomstenbelasting, vermogensbelasting of andere fiscale zaken, we kunnen je koppelen aan de juiste expert.

promise.title: Onze belofte aan jou
items: Binnen 24 uur koppelen we je aan een geschikte adviseur
Alle adviseurs zijn gecertificeerd en gecontroleerd

story.title: Our Story
paragraphs: Jan de Belastingman was founded with a clear mission: to democratize tax advice and make expert guidance accessible to everyone in the Netherlands.

The idea came from firsthand experience working at a foundation that provided low-cost tax assistance. It became clear that a huge gap existed between tax expertise and the people who needed it, especially when tax situations became more complex. Many struggled with unclear rules, expensive advisors, and a lack of digital solutions.

With this in mind, a team of experts in AI, finance, and digital innovation set out to create a smarter, more accessible way to get tax help. The vision was set and the team built and scaled Jan de Belastingman to what it is today.

team.title: Our Team
team.description: At Jan de Belastingman, our team combines deep expertise in tax, technology, and business with the goal to make tax advice simple and accessible. With backgrounds in AI, finance, and innovation, we're dedicated to helping you navigate your tax matters with confidence.

members.name: Bo
members.background: A digital innovation leader, with a track record of guiding teams to executional excellence, creating people-focused solutions through smarter technology.

members.name: Tim
members.background: A growth strategist with 14+ years of experience in building brands and scaling digital startups through impactful marketing.

members.name: Beaudinn
members.background: A full-stack engineer with a decade of experience in AI and data-driven development, building secure, scalable, and high-performing systems.

members.name: Mathijs
members.background: A serial entrepreneur with a fiscal background, leveraging AI to build forward-thinking businesses that transform industries.

members.name: Marcus
members.background: An AI and SaaS innovator, driving multiple ventures that push technology forward and redefine digital solutions.

milestones.subtitle: Founded with a mission
milestones.description: We established Jan de Belastingman to democratize tax advice, making expert guidance affordable and accessible for everyone.
We launched the first AI-powered chat assistant, helping our first X customers navigate their taxes with ease.
We integrated the latest AI advancements to create an intelligent assistant capable of handling complex situations.
We expanded our team and introduced advanced features tailored for businesses and freelancers.

milestones.subtitle: Becoming Go-To Tax Assistant
milestones.description: We continue to innovate and strive to become the go-to tax assistant for all of the Netherlands.

partners.title: Our Trusted Partners
partners.description: To strengthen our services, we work closely with a network of reliable, certified partners. These experts bring deep knowledge and experience in specific tax domains, allowing us to offer an even broader range of specialized tax advice.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: Jan de Belastingman strives to make quality tax advice accessible to everyone. We want to save people time and money by providing reliable, understandable guidance on their tax matters.

vision.description: We envision a future where everyone in the Netherlands can handle their tax matters with confidence, supported by advanced AI technology and human expertise.
points: Collaboration with experts for specialized advice

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions and Latest Articles

faqItems.question: What is a BV and why should I establish one?
faqItems.answer: A BV (Private Limited Company) is a legal entity where the company is a separate legal person, distinct from its owners. Establishing a BV can offer advantages in terms of liability, taxes, and attracting investors. It's particularly suitable for entrepreneurs who want to separate their personal assets from company assets and who expect their business to grow.

faqItems.question: What tax benefits does a BV offer?
faqItems.answer: A BV can offer various tax benefits, including a lower corporate tax rate for profits up to €395,000 (15% in 2023), the ability to retain profits within the BV for reinvestment at a lower rate, and the option to pay yourself a salary and receive dividends. Additionally, there are tax optimization opportunities that aren't available for sole proprietorships or general partnerships.

faqItems.question: How can Jan de Belastingman help me manage my BV?
faqItems.answer: Jan de Belastingman provides expert advice and support in various areas of BV management, including tax planning, compliance with laws and regulations, financial reporting, and strategic advice. Our AI-powered chatbot can provide immediate answers to common questions, while our network of experienced advisors is available for more complex matters. We help you keep your BV financially healthy and make optimal use of available tax benefits.

faqItems.question: When is the tax return deadline?
faqItems.answer: The standard deadline for filing your Dutch income tax return is May 1st for the previous tax year. Extensions may be possible in certain circumstances.

faqItems.question: What documents do I need?
faqItems.answer: You'll need your annual income statement (jaaropgaaf), bank statements, mortgage information, and documentation for any deductions you plan to claim.

faqItems.question: What tax credits are available?
faqItems.answer: Common tax credits include the general tax credit, labor tax credit, and income-dependent credits for healthcare and rent.

faqItems.question: How do I claim tax credits?
faqItems.answer: Most credits are automatically applied when filing your tax return. Some specific credits may need to be claimed separately.

faqItems.question: What are the inheritance tax rates?
faqItems.answer: Dutch inheritance tax rates vary from 10% to 40%, depending on your relationship to the deceased and the value of the inheritance.

faqItems.question: Are there any exemptions?
faqItems.answer: Yes, there are various exemptions available, particularly for spouses and children. The amounts depend on your relationship to the deceased.

hero.title: Professional guidance for your Housing Allowance (Huurtoeslag)
hero.description: Are you frustrated with the high rent prices? Depending on your age, who you live with, the rental price and the combined incomes of the household, you might be eligible for housing allowance. Jan de Belastingman can check everything for you and help you save some costs!
hero.callToAction: Need Housing Allowance Assistance? Chat With Us!

support.title: Housing allowance In the Netherlands
support.description: The rent benefit (huurtoeslag) is a subsidy provided by the government to help with your rent expenses. Originally aimed at households with moderate incomes, it predominantly benefits those on the lower income spectrum.

items.title: 1. Create your account
items.description: To use Jan de Belastingman you must create an account. Creating an account is easy by starting the tax chat and registering via Social login (Facebook or Google) or with your email address. You will then immediately have your personal account. Jan de Belastingman attaches great importance to carefully handling your personal data. Personal data is therefore processed and secured using GDPR standards.

items.title: 2. Ask your housing question
items.description: Start your conversation with Jan de Belastingman, the digital tax advisor who is always available and ask all your questions about the complex tax system for free. You will be able to fill in your income in your tax return, but what about the other deductions such as healthcare costs, donations, study costs, etc.? Are there specific benefits to which you are entitled? Jan de Belastingman will find out and help you with all.

items.title: 3. Get free housing allowance advice
items.description: Jan de Belastingman immediately provides you with independent and reliable housing allowance advice on your question. You can take this advice with you and consult it when completing your housing allowance form. Should Jan de Belastingman not have the answer immediately available, because it is a bit more complex? Jan de Belastingman will then contact you within 24 hours.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions and Latest Articles

faqItems.question: What are the requirements for housing allowance?
faqItems.answer: You must have a signed rental agreement, be registered at the address, be at least 18 years old, have a valid residence permit, and live in a self-sufficient home. Your income and assets must also be below certain thresholds.

faqItems.question: How is housing allowance calculated?
faqItems.answer: The amount depends on your rent, income, household composition, and assets. The calculation takes into account the total household income and the number of people living at the address.

faqItems.question: Can I get housing allowance if I share a house?
faqItems.answer: Yes, but specific rules apply for shared housing. All residents must be registered at the address, and the total household income is considered in the calculation.

support.title: Childcare Allowance Support
support.description: Childcare allowance (kinderopvangtoeslag) helps parents with the costs of childcare while they work or study. The amount depends on your income, the number of children, and the type of childcare used. Our experts can help you understand your entitlements and guide you through the application process.

items.title: 1. Create your account
items.description: To use Jan de Belastingman you must create an account. Creating an account is easy by starting the tax chat and registering via Social login (Facebook or Google) or with your email address. You will then immediately have your personal account. Jan de Belastingman attaches great importance to carefully handling your personal data. Personal data is therefore processed and secured using GDPR standards.

items.title: 2. Ask your childcare allowance question
items.description: Start your conversation with Jan de Belastingman, our digital advisor who is always available to answer your questions about childcare allowance. Whether you're wondering about eligibility, required documents, or how to maximize your benefits, we're here to help you navigate the system effectively.

items.title: 3. Get free childcare allowance advice
items.description: Jan de Belastingman immediately provides you with independent and reliable advice about your childcare allowance questions. You can take this advice with you and consult it when completing your application. For more complex situations, we'll connect you with an expert advisor within 24 hours.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions and Latest Articles

faqItems.question: Who is eligible for childcare allowance?
faqItems.answer: You may be eligible if you and your partner work, study, or follow an integration course, have children under 12, use registered childcare, and pay the costs yourself. The exact amount depends on your income and the childcare hours needed.

faqItems.question: What types of childcare are covered?
faqItems.answer: The allowance covers registered daycare (kinderdagverblijf), out-of-school care (buitenschoolse opvang), and registered childminders (gastouderopvang). The childcare provider must be registered in the National Childcare Register (LRK).

faqItems.question: How is the allowance calculated?
faqItems.answer: The amount is based on your household income, the number of children in childcare, the type of childcare, and the hourly rate (up to a maximum). The lower your income, the higher the percentage of costs that will be reimbursed.

support.title: Child Benefit Support
support.description: Child benefit (kinderbijslag) is a quarterly payment from the government to help with the costs of raising children under 18. The amount depends on your child's age and living situation. Our experts can help you understand your entitlements and guide you through the application process.

items.title: 1. Create your account
items.description: To use Jan de Belastingman you must create an account. Creating an account is easy by starting the tax chat and registering via Social login (Facebook or Google) or with your email address. You will then immediately have your personal account. Jan de Belastingman attaches great importance to carefully handling your personal data. Personal data is therefore processed and secured using GDPR standards.

items.description: Start your conversation with Jan de Belastingman, our digital advisor who is always available to answer your questions about child benefit. Whether you're wondering about eligibility, required documents, or payment schedules, we're here to help you navigate the system effectively.

items.title: 3. Get free child benefit advice
items.description: Jan de Belastingman immediately provides you with independent and reliable advice about your child benefit questions. You can take this advice with you and consult it when completing your application. For more complex situations, we'll connect you with an expert advisor within 24 hours.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions and Latest Articles

faqItems.question: Who is eligible for child benefit?
faqItems.answer: You're eligible if you live or work in the Netherlands and have children under 18. The child must be your own, adopted, or stepchild, and you must be taking care of them. Special rules apply for children studying or living abroad.

faqItems.question: How much child benefit will I receive?
faqItems.answer: The amount depends on your child's age: 0-5 years, 6-11 years, or 12-17 years. Each age group receives a different quarterly payment. The exact amounts are adjusted twice a year based on price developments.

faqItems.question: When and how is child benefit paid?
faqItems.answer: Child benefit is paid quarterly by the SVB (Social Insurance Bank). The payment dates are in January, April, July, and October. The money is transferred directly to your bank account.

support.title: AOW Pension Support
support.description: The AOW (Algemene Ouderdomswet) is the Dutch state pension, providing basic income security for everyone who has lived or worked in the Netherlands. Understanding your rights, the tax implications, and how to maximize your benefits is essential for a comfortable retirement.

items.title: 1. Create your account
items.description: To use Jan de Belastingman you must create an account. Creating an account is easy by starting the tax chat and registering via Social login (Facebook or Google) or with your email address. You will then immediately have your personal account. Jan de Belastingman attaches great importance to carefully handling your personal data. Personal data is therefore processed and secured using GDPR standards.

items.title: 2. Ask your AOW pension question
items.description: Start your conversation with Jan de Belastingman, our digital advisor who is always available to answer your questions about AOW pension. Whether you're wondering about eligibility, payment amounts, or tax implications, we're here to help you understand your state pension rights.

items.title: 3. Get free AOW pension advice
items.description: Jan de Belastingman immediately provides you with independent and reliable advice about your AOW pension questions. You can take this advice with you and consult it when needed. For more complex situations, we'll connect you with an expert advisor within 24 hours.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions and Latest Articles

faqItems.question: When do I receive AOW pension?
faqItems.answer: The AOW pension age is gradually increasing. In 2024, it's 67 years. You automatically receive a letter from the SVB a few months before you reach AOW age, with information about your pension payments.

faqItems.question: How is AOW pension calculated?
faqItems.answer: The amount depends on your living situation and how long you've lived in the Netherlands between ages 15 and AOW age. Each year contributes 2% to your full pension rights. Living or working abroad may affect your pension amount.

faqItems.question: What are the tax implications of AOW pension?
faqItems.answer: AOW pension is taxable income in the Netherlands. The tax rate depends on your total income, including any additional pensions or other income sources. We can help you understand your tax obligations and potential deductions.

support.title: Income During AOW Support
support.description: Many people continue working or earn additional income while receiving AOW pension. This can affect your tax situation and potentially your benefits. Understanding these implications is essential for making informed financial decisions.

items.title: 1. Create your account
items.description: To use Jan de Belastingman you must create an account. Creating an account is easy by starting the tax chat and registering via Social login (Facebook or Google) or with your email address. You will then immediately have your personal account. Jan de Belastingman attaches great importance to carefully handling your personal data. Personal data is therefore processed and secured using GDPR standards.

items.title: 2. Ask your income during AOW question
items.description: Start your conversation with Jan de Belastingman, our digital advisor who is always available to answer your questions about earning income while receiving AOW pension. Whether you're wondering about tax brackets, deductions, or how additional income affects your benefits, we're here to help.

items.title: 3. Get free income during AOW advice
items.description: Jan de Belastingman immediately provides you with independent and reliable advice about your income during AOW questions. You can take this advice with you and consult it when needed. For more complex situations, we'll connect you with an expert advisor within 24 hours.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions and Latest Articles

faqItems.question: How does additional income affect my AOW pension?
faqItems.answer: Your AOW pension amount itself isn't affected by additional income, but your total income may affect your tax bracket and potential benefits or allowances you receive. We can help you understand the implications and optimize your tax situation.

faqItems.question: What are the tax implications of working during AOW?
faqItems.answer: When you work while receiving AOW, both your pension and work income are taxed. However, you may be eligible for specific tax credits and deductions. The total tax rate depends on your combined income from all sources.

faqItems.question: Are there limits to how much I can earn alongside AOW?
faqItems.answer: There's no limit to how much you can earn while receiving AOW pension. However, higher income may affect other benefits or allowances you receive, such as healthcare allowance or rent subsidy.
